answers.answer: Hi!The feet need to be dipped for 15-20 mins in warm water to which a few drops of hydrogen peroxide is added and cleaned well and the patted dry. It should be cleaned with betadine lotion or any other surgical cleaner. The pus should be drained by pressing the cracks and anti-bacterial cream applied. Once the infection dries up, a very good moisturizer or an emollient cream or petroleum jelly can be applied daily and at bed time. Once the cracks heal, regular pedicure will help keep the feet soft and supple. Also, since the cracks got infected, good personal hygiene should be maintained. Blood sugar should be tested as diabetes can make a person prone to infection. Please consult your doctor regarding this.
